title: Ex-Eagles sparkplug Leroy Keyes dead at 74
body: Philadelphia Eagles defensive back Leroy Keyes (20), seen here tackling John Roland (23) of the St. Louis Cardinals, died Thursday at the age of 74.The  announced former running back/defensive back/return specialist   Thursday at his home in West Lafayette, Indiana. He was 74 years old.Keyes was the Eagles’ first-round draft pick, No. 3 overall, in the  (going one spot ahead of Hall of Famer ). He came to Philadelphia after an , where he earned the nickname “The Golden Mr. Do-Everything.” According to the Eagles, Keyes finished as the school’s all-time leader in touchdowns (37), points (222) and all-purpose yards (3,757).Keyes finished second in voting for the (which went to USC’s O.J. SImpson), and was inducted into the the . Keyes went on to play four seasons with the Eagles before finishing his  career in 1973 with the .Keyes is survived by his wife, Monica, and their four children: Raymond, Jacqueline, Courtland, and Colin.
